case_vignette: A 60-year-old man presents with rapidly growing lesions on his face, trunk, axillae, flexural areas, and groin. The lesions appeared 3 months earlier in his perianal area and extended rapidly to other areas. Previously, he was treated with topical agents for atopic dermatitis and seborrheic dermatitis without improvement. Examination reveals disseminated violaceous papules and plaques on the face, trunk, axillae, and perianal area; some lesions were confluent and ulcerated. Yellowish-red to skin-colored papules are present on the scalp. He has no palpable lymphadenopathy or organomegaly.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have rapidly growing spots on my face, chest, underarms, elbows, and groin area that started about three months ago around my bottom and have spread to other areas.
What is your age and sex?
I am a 60-year-old man.
Have you noticed any changes in the color or the size of the spots since they appeared?
Yes, the spots have grown in size, and they are purplish in color on my face, chest, and other areas; some have even turned into sores.
Do the spots or sores itch, hurt, or bleed?
The details about itching, pain, or bleeding were not provided.
Have you experienced any fever, weight loss, night sweats, or fatigue recently?
No, I haven't experienced any of those symptoms.
Do you have a history of prolonged sun exposure or frequent use of tanning beds?
My medical history regarding sun exposure or tanning bed use wasn't mentioned.
Have you previously been diagnosed with any skin conditions or other chronic health issues?
I was treated before for skin conditions they called atopic dermatitis and seborrheic dermatitis.
Do you have any known immune system issues or have you undergone any organ transplants?
No information about immune system issues or organ transplants was provided.
Are you currently taking any medications, including over-the-counter drugs or supplements?
I have used topical agents for my previous skin conditions, but no improvement was seen.
Is there a history of skin cancer or any other type of cancer in your family?
My family history regarding cancer wasn't mentioned.
Have the spots changed in texture or do they bleed when you scratch or bump them?
Some of the spots have turned into sores, but there was no mention of bleeding when scratched or bumped.
Final Diagnosis: Kaposi's sarcoma.
